intro: Dodecatheon pulchellum var. alaskanum, commonly known as the Alaska larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the northwestern United States and southern Canada. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as alpine meadows and forested areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. The Alaska larkspur is notable for its ornamental value and its role in local ecosystems.
